summary: US equity indexes rose this week, led by gains in defensive sectors of the market after a trade crisis . US equity markets rose in the wake of the global economic crisis .

Shares of Nvidia were down nearly 4% in recent trading . President Trump said China has "totally violated its agreement with us," dampening hopes the countries would soon come to a longer-term agreement .  Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said it's "terrific" that the Biden-era rule was rescinded . Huang criticized the administration's other moves to limit its sales to China, saying that "shielding Chinese chipmakers from U.S. competition only strengthens them abroad and weakens America's position"

SMCI shares slid nearly3%to $39.7 on Friday afternoon, falling 57% back from a 52-week high of $101.40 . Despite trade-tariff uncertainties, SMCI finds support in itslink to NVIDIA(NASDAQ:NVDA) and rising demand for Blackwell chips . Saudi government tapped SMCI to build AI-focused data centers, signaling faith in its Foundry servers .  Based on the one year price targets offered by 15 analysts, the average target price for Super Micro Computer Inc is $40.00 . SMCI's role in supporting NVDA's Blackwell ecosystem offers a clear catalyst, even as tariffs and macro headwinds persist .

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the $50 billion market for AI chips in China is now “effectively closed to U.S. industry’s . Huang: H20 processor, previously approved for China, was required to obtain an export license . The chipmaker booked a $4.5 billion charge for the fiscal first quarter, ended April 27 .  Nvidia is the top supplier of graphics-processing units, which are essential to power and train large AI models worldwide . China remains a key market for Nvidia, accounting for 13% of its sales in the past financial year .  Nvidia reported adjusted earnings of 96 cents per share on $44.06 billion in revenue for its fiscal first quarter, beating Wall Street’s expectations . Data-center revenue has grown at a remarkable pace, driven by demand across the U.S., Europe, and the Gulf States . In fiscal 2024, revenue for the data-center segment tripled .  Nvidia forecasts $45 billion, plus or minus 2%, of revenue for the July quarter . Analysts had projected $45.9 billion, but it noted that the figure would have been roughly $8 billion higher without the China export curbs . Since April 4, when the stock hit a recent bottom price of $94.31, it has surged by more than 47% .  Analysts saw three positive upsides from the company's earnings call: Blackwell racks in full production, China derisked, and gross margin likely to go back to mid-70s percent by year-end . Still, Bank of America highlights risks such as potential delays and supply-chain issues from a faster, annual product cycle .  Year to date, Nvidia stock is up 3.65% while the S&P 500 Index is up 0.52% . "Last, we can't ignore headline or real risks from use of (or restriction on) AI products as a bargaining tool in global trade deals," analysts added .

Nvidia reported overall mixed earnings for Q1, topping Wall Street estimates on several key metrics . However, the consensus among analysts seems to be that the results are encouraging enough for investors to proceed with optimism that the chipmaker's growth will continue .  Since the launch of ChatGPT in 2022, the AI market has grown quickly, and many investors have zeroed in on Nvidia as the undisputed leader . The company has benefited significantly from this, rising steadily as global demand for its graphics processing units (GPUs) has trended upward . However, in January 2025, a Chinese AI startup called DeepSeek triggered a massive chip stock selloff when the company released an AI model built on less advanced Nvidia chips .  Nvidia said it expects the H20 licensing requirement to result in an $8 billion revenue hit during Q2, which it projects to be roughly $45 billion . The company also shared that due to this new policy, it had been rendered unable to ship an additional $2.5 billion worth of H20 products during Q1 .  President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance have stressed the need for less regulation on the AI industry . The licensing requirement stands to compromise Nvidia’s quest to continue selling a popular chip in China, a market the company does not want to lose . Now the AI leader is at even greater risk of being pushed out of the Chinese market .  Nvidia stands to lose billions, thanks to new U.S. policy, says Huang . China’s market is critical to the success of any chipmaker . Even if Nvidia can successfully market and sell this new chip in China, it won't be able to recoup the losses it has suffered .

This was nothing if not a choppy, holiday-shortened week . Markets opened on Tuesday to the news that European tariffs of 50% were now on hold . The U.S. Court of International Trade ruled that Trump had overstepped his power in enacting his so-called Liberation Day tariffs .  For the past five days, stocks were up around 1%, most of the gain occuring Tuesday morning . For the entire week, the picture was a little rosier . Bonds, gold, and crude were all higher this week .  U.S. traders, including foreign, bought US debt this week . US debt credit default swaps have been on the rise . JP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon agrees with him that the US is now being considered to be as risky as Italy and Greece .  Stocks opened lower after the president tweeted that China had "totally violated its agreement with us" 80% of S&P 500 stocks on the decline, but the index is well off the day's lows . Costco's shares are higher following yesterday's earnings and revenue report, which beat expectations .  S&P futures are down 33 points; Nasdaq is lower by 130 . Palantir is a stock favored by TheStreet Pro's Stephen "Sarge" Guilfoyle . Sarge reports that he's taken some profits in the company .  The PCE Index, short for inflation, is a measure of inflation . The index is the Federal Reserve's preferred benchmark for prices as it determines interest-rate policy . Nvidia drops 0.4% after being down as much 1.4%, but is now 0.3% lower .  The New York Times reports Musk used heavy amounts of drugs while on the campaign trail last fall with President Trump . His use of ketamine was so great that he suffered from bladder problems, a known effect of chronic use .

The tech-heavy Nasdaq fell 0.3%, while the S&P 500 was flat at Friday's market close . Bloomberg reported Friday midday that the Trump administration is planning to broaden its trade restrictions on China's tech industry . The two countries had agreed to reduce sky-high tariffs in mid-May .  Nvidia took a $5.5 billion hit from the Trump administration’s separate, recent, recent ban on sales of its chips to China . Most of the company's chips are made in Taiwan and then manufactured in servers in Mexico or Taiwan . Nvidia revealed in its latest quarterly earnings report this week that it lost $2.2 billion in sales in the first quarter .  Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the company has no new products planned for the Chinese market . Some on Wall Street remain optimistic about Nvidia's China prospects . Even with the drop, Nvidia stock was on track to notch a more than 3% gain .  Nvidia shares rose 3% Thursday after the AI chipmaker reported first quarter revenue that surpassed Wall Street’s expectations . Despite the China-related headwinds, Nvidia shares were up 3% in the trading week .

Nvidia trades at much higher valuation multiples than Alphabet, making it an expensive bet on future AI growth . Alphabet's stable business and lower valuation make it appealing for value-focused investors . Nvidia still has upside potential for a certain type of high-growth investors .  Nvidia's stock price has multiplied by 8 in about 30 months . Nvidia's business may be booming, but those shares are changing hands at the lofty valuation of 25 times sales . Many investors will look no further, walking away from these deal-breaking valuation multiples .  An overwhelming majority of analysts tracking this stock call it a "buy" and the average one-year price target is about 24% above the current value . Nvidia can charge very high prices for its AI accelerator chips and be more limited by manufacturing capacity than by customer demand . Nvidia's profits have skyrocketed much faster than the plain top-line sales .  Alphabet makes more money than Nvidia, even after the chip guru's massive growth spurt . The Google parent's annual revenues are about three times the size of Nvidia's . That makes Alphabet a value-oriented bet on the generative AI boom .  The company just might be able to stave off AI chip rivals for years to come, until the ballooning valuation finally makes sense . Alphabet is a much more tempting idea, pairing the company's ultimate longevity with a very reasonable share price . It's one of my favorite investments of all time, and a particularly strong buy at today's modest valuation . Doudna will pair Nvidia's latest Vera Rubin chips with Dell's liquid-cooled servers to support roughly 11,000 researchers nationwide . System is designed to merge simulation, data, and artificial intelligence on a single platform .  Nvidia also faces scrutiny over plans for a Shanghai R&D facility, with lawmakers raising national security concerns . curbs have cost the company billions .

Nvidia posted revenue of $44.06 billion for the April quarter, a 69% jump from a year earlier and ahead of the $43.34 billion forecast . Earnings per share reached $0.81, comfortably beating the consensus . The company said July quarter revenue could come in as high as $45.90 billion, suggesting 50% year-over-year growth .  Nvidia is still leaning hard into enterprise AI, but its not ignoring other growth channels . Gross margin slipped to 71.3% after a $4.5 billion charge related to restricted H20 chip sales into China . Management expects margins to bounce back into the mid-70% range .

The Vanguard Information Technology Index Fund and the Vanguard Growth Index Fund have produced some fantastic returns for investors in the past five years . Both offer broad diversification, holding well over 100 stocks in their portfolios . As is usual at Vanguard, both funds charge incredibly low fees to investors .  The S&P 500's total returns (which include dividends) are 109% over the past five years . Given the strong trends in AI and investments that continue to flow into AI-related projects, this ETF can still be an excellent option for your portfolio .  The Vanguard Information Technology Index Fund can be an excellent long-term investment . Most of the stocks in the fund account for no more than 4% of its total holdings, with the exception being the big three:Apple,Microsoft, and Nvidia . For a more balanced option outside of tech, you may want to consider the Vanguard Growth Index Fund .  The same top three stocks that make up the bulk of the Vanguard tech fund are also the top three in this ETF . The more diversified Vanguard Growth Index Fund, which charges a lower expense ratio of 0.04%, can be a better option for more . Shares of Navitas Semiconductor rallied again this week after raising more money . Normally equity raises cause a stock to go down, so why was this one different? Navitas was able to sell stock at much higher prices on the heels of last week's Nvidia partnership announcement .  Navitas filed with the SEC for an at-the-market stock sale program, in which it could sell stock to raise money on the open market throughJefferiesinvestment bank, for up to $50 million . In the previous quarter, Navitas saw its revenue decline 40%, with operating losses of $25.3 million .  Navitas was just one of several power chip providers named in the Kyber effort . Investors interested in high-upside, high-risk situations in the artificial intelligence sector should continue to follow this story . Stock market futures are rallying, buoyed by a federal court ruling that blocked several of President Trump’s import tariffs . Tesla shares rose over 2% after CEO Elon Musk announced he would step down from his government role at the Department of Government Efficiency to refocus on his companies . Commodity markets are reacting to thetariffnews as well, with expectations of increased demand and reduced trade barriers .  In pre-market trading, S&P 500 futures rose 0.76% and Nasdaq futures rose 1.27% . The Fly compiled this morning's top movers from around Wall Street, compiled by The Fly .  Burlington Stores backs FY25 adjusted EPS view $8.70-$9.30, consensus $9.26 . Burlington Stores sees Q2 adjusted EPS $1.20-$1.30; Q3 sees Q4 adjusted EPS of $1.,1.67; Q4 Q2 Q3 adjusted EPS was $1,9.67, consensus Q3 Q4 FY25 was $8.,9.70, Q3 was $9.,8.30 .

NVIDIA (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA), Taiwan Semi (TSM) andTrumpMedia (DJT) saw the greatest growth .  Nvidia price target raised to $135 from $120 at DA Davidson and $165 from $150 at Raymond James . The race to better compete with Nvidia (NVDA) is well underway . Private company Groq (GROQ.PVT) is led by chip veteran Jonathan Ross . Ross designed the custom chips that the tech giant would go on to use for training its AI models .  Groq's last capital raise came in August 2024, when it raised $640 million from companies including BlackRock (BLK) and Cisco (CSCO) Ross was able to secure $1.5 billion from Saudi Arabia to expand AI chip delivery to the country .  Three times each week, Yahoo Finance Executive EditorBrian Sozzifields insight-filled conversations and chats with the biggest names in business and markets onOpening Bid . Ross: Saudi Arabia is net exporter of intelligence .

U.S. export controls cost Nvidia $2.5 billion in Q1 revenue and could block another $8 billion . China was once a $50 billion opportunity, but company now has no replacement chip ready for H20 model . Nvidia forecast $45 billion in July-quarter sales and pointed to strength in its Blackwell chips .  Nvidia is also prepping Blackwell Ultra for release this quarter, with early access going to top cloud partners . The rest of the business is accelerating beyond China .

Nvidia (NVDA,Financials) saysit'll pull in $45 billion this quarter, even after U.S. export curbs shaved $2.5 billion off Q1 sales and could cost another $8 billion in Q2 . China was 12.5% of Q1 revenue, as buyers rushed to grab Nvidia's H20 chip before ban kicked in . CEO Jensen Huang praised Trump for scrapping one export rule, but slammed another for blocking H20 sales .  GuruFocus. appeared on GuruFocus.com . On Wall Street, it's been years since anyone had to think very hard to make money . Buy the largest US stocks, ignore everything else and watch your portfolio soar . Then life got more complicated. President Donald Trump’s sudden tariff escalation in April offered a glimpse of what a world without that certainty might look like . Confidence wavered, but after a sharp market decline, some of the panic subsided .  The market and political mayhem highlighted the fragility of the one-way buy-America trade . Moody’s Ratings’ (MCO) recent decision to downgrade U.S. debt . Money managers pitching a slew of allocation ideas to investors .  GMO International Developed Equity Allocation Fund is up about 20% this year . The fund has about half its assets in Europe and almost 30% in Japan .  Exchange-traded funds holding value stocks have already seen $30 billion in inflows this year . Hedge funds attracted about $14 billion in cash this year through April . Quantitatively driven diversification strategies are gaining fresh attention .  This year “has been about making diversification look great again,” says Dan Villalon, principal at AQR Capital Management LLC, a Greenwich, Connecticut-based manager of quant and hedge fund strategies . Of course, the push to spread out risks comes with big pitfalls .  Villalon, for example, has been an outspoken critic of buffer funds . AQR has published research arguing that a simple mix of stocks and safe Treasury bills is a better bet for those seeking downside protection .  Investors seem to have widened their view of the range of outcomes . For Vineer Bhansali, CIO and founder of LongTail Alpha LLC, it’s been the busiest time since the onset of the pandemic .  Australian pension fund allocated to strategies . “Everybody has a lot of US assets,” Bhansali says. “Trade, the reason this whole thing is happening, is a global phenomenon. Everybody gets pulled into it.”

Investors will want to see if British American Tobacco has continued to generate sales growth from its new categories business . Investors will also be keen to see how Dr Martens' turnaround efforts are progressing when the iconic bootmaker reports its full-year results .  Shares in Nvidia (NVDA) jumped after it reported another blowout quarteron Wednesday . The chipmaker posted revenue of $44.1bn (£32.7bn) for the first quarter .  Consensus forecasts for Broadcom's (AVGO) second quarter revenue are broadly in line with the company's guidance of approximately $14.9bn, which works out to growth of around 19% . Nathan said that artificial intelligence (AI) is a growing share of Broadcom’s revenue base but there's still more sales coming from non-AI workloads .  Broadcom (AVGO) shares popped after its first quarter results beat on the top and bottom lines, driven by AI chip sales . Shares in Lululemon (LULU) sunk after its earnings outlook appeared to underwhelm investors .  Barclays analysts said they were "cautious" on Lululemon (LULU) Barclays analysts highlighted that the retailer's "We Made Too Much" online clearance section "showed an increase towards the end of the quarter" for the first quarter . British American Tobacco announced it had sold a 2.5% stake in Indian consumer goods company ITC (ITC.NS)  BAT (BATS.L) posted a 5.2% decline in reported revenue for the year at £25.9bn . The tobacco giant also said that the net proceeds from the trade would be used to extend its share buyback programme by an additional £200m ($269.5m)  Company saw 8.9% organic growth from revenue in its new categories business at £3.4bn . Analysts say investors will be watching closely to see if US action to crackdown on illegal competition has had any impact and whether the lifting of a proposed ban on menthol will have any impact .  Analysts expect full-year total revenue for 2025 to come in at £26.2bn, including £3.88bn from new category business . Dr Martens reported 3% growth in group revenue at £267m in the third quarter .  The US, the company's biggest market, is proving particularly tough, Streeter says . She said that the "performance of the last quarter will be a test" for new CEO Nwokorie . Streeter said that increased investment in marketing was paying off .  French cognac maker Rémy Cointreau appoints Franck Marilly as new CEO . Marilly will take over from Eric Vallat, who said last month he would be stepping down . The stock is still down nearly 19% year-to-date .  China launched ananti-dumping investigation on brandy imported from the European Union in January . The probe was considered to be in response to EU duties on Chinese electric vehicles . Investors will be looking at Rémy Cointreau's (RCO.PA) final full-year results on Wednesday .  The company said in April that a €50m (£42m) cost-cutting plan would help protect its operating margin . It also reiterated its financial targets for 2029-30 of hitting a gross margin of 72% and an operating margin of 33% .  You can read Yahoo Finance's full calendar here . Cerence AI has entered into a strategic partnership with Arm to enhance the capabilities and performance of its CaLLM Edge, an embedded small language model . The partnership aims to address the challenges of optimizing compute performance for intensive workloads like large language models .  NVIDIA ended the day at $139.19 up 3.2% . Kalshi has taken a battering ram to the regulatory establishment in its bid to give Americans the inalienable right to bet on everything . The seven-year old financial exchange is taking it to a whole new level by using its federal financial license to open up sports gambling nationwide . The move has earned the New York-based prediction market cease-and-desist letters from state gaming agencies .  Kalshi is a high-tech casino operating in a legal gray zone . Co-founders say Wall Street blurred the line between investing and gambling long ago . The company's recent legal victories are bound to stir unease among those who worry about the social harms .  Kalshi. offers around 1,200 markets - up from 300 last fall - and plans to boost that five- to 10-fold this year . They’re still minnows by Wall Street standards, with daily trading volumes measured in millions of dollars .  Kalshi hosted $1 billion of trades on the election . The CFTC argued the firm was running a “Trojan horse’s transformation into a large-scale election gambling market . Since then, though, Mansour and his co-founder have quickly made the journey from spurned outsiders to establishment favorites .  In the founders’ view, prediction markets offer a way for ordinary Americans and financial professionals alike to buy insurance against real-world events . The strategy raises uncomfortable questions for Wall Street, which has sold the idea that markets are about capital formation and price discovery, rather than a casino for speculation .  CFTC co-founder Kalshi met with then president-elect Trump at an Ultimate Fighting Championship bout, adding Donald Trump Jr. as advisor, and co-hosting a party with TikTok to celebrate pro-Trump influencers . Mansour, the more pugnacious and defiant of the two co-founders, hit back at what he referred to as the “woke mob” just three days after inauguration, began listing sports bets for the first time .  79% of Kalshi’s recent volumes have been related to sports, according to analysis by Bloomberg Intelligence . The excitement around the company was evident at an oversubscribed event in April .  Kalshi previously acknowledged that CFTC rules showed “Congress did not want sports betting to be conducted on derivatives markets” The move into sports betting marks an about-face . It’s a far cry from when Mansour and Lopes Lara founded the firm in 2018, soon after graduating from MIT .  Kalshi is based on the humble event contract, which makes it possible to place a binary bet on a particular outcome . The company got a license to be an exchange from the CFTC back in 2020 .  Kalshi does operate its own market maker on the exchange, which trades with customers . The startup’s argument about CFTC authority has been persuasive enough to score preliminary victories in lawsuits against Nevada and New Jersey .  Kalshi's business model has created concerns among Wall Street firms who answer to similar regulators . Polymarket, which operates globally but is banned in the US, has been pulling in bigger numbers . Another player, Crypto.com, has hired a lawyer who worked at the CFTC .  PredictIt, which ran a limited prediction market for years under an academic partnership, says it's optimistic it will receive its CFTC license soon . With sports betting garnering $3.87 billion in gross revenue in the first quarter, the industry looks like a huge opportunity . Flutter Entertainment Plc, which runs FanDuel, sees prediction markets as way to get into sports gambling in states where it's not legal yet .  The structure of prediction markets could make it hard for Kalshi to expand into short-term bets during live games . The startup says sports parlays and wagers on in-game player performance are not on its roadmap . If it succeeds, it could kick open a new asset class to the masses .  Mark Zuckerberg Loves MAGA Now. Aehr's biggest customer isON Semiconductor, to which Aehr sells silicon carbide wafer-level burn-in solutions .  Aehr had four customers representing 10% of its revenue in the third quarter . ON Semiconductor and other SiC companies are suffering this year due to their focus on the automotive electric vehicle market . Aehr has diversified into other markets, attracting new customers in turn .  The Motley Fool Stock Advisoranalyst team identified what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy now . Many of the best growth stocks in the world are based out of the U.S. This is the land of both opportunity and innovation . These three companies have experienced significant growth . All generate strong profit margins, which can help them weather a challenging economy .  Nvidia is based in the U.S. but it isn't immune to the effects of tariffs or trade wars . With such high profit margins, it's in much better shape than other companies to be able to absorb higher costs and headwinds related to economic uncertainty .  Indianapolis-based Eli Lilly is another great American growth stock to buy and hold . Its GLP-1 drug Tirzepatide resulted in two highly successful products for Eli Lilly . Together, those drugs generated more than $6 billion in sales through the first three months of 2025, representing nearly half of the top line .  Palo Alto Networks is a cybersecurity company founded 20 years ago . Its subscription and support segment generated $1.8 billion in sales for the quarter ended April 30 . The company benefits from a large chunk of its top line being from recurring revenue .  Palo Alto is trading at more than 100 times its trailing earnings . It's a big improvement from just a few years ago when the business was still in the red . The company's top line relies heavily on software and support services, making it less vulnerable to tariffs . Investors should take a breath now and look at investing in some of the strongest artificial intelligence (AI) companies . Three AI names can help deliver strong returns in 2025 and beyond .  Nvidia is delivering enterprises the computing power, systems, tools, and algorithms needed . CEO Jensen Huang is a proven visionary, and the company even has growth triggers beyond the world of AI . Uses includegenerative AIand speech recognition, medical imaging and more efficient supply chain management . Nvidia is also part of larger-scale projects like the recently announced United Arab Emirates Stargate global tech alliance . Nvidia will miss out on $8 billion worth of H20 chip sales in its second quarter, due to tightened export controls . The company is locked in the middle of geopolitical tensions with China .  The chip ban can be wielded as a bargaining chip in the broader China trade war . CEO Jensen Huang is saying all the right things too . Chase Coleman's Tiger Global Management fund made some major purchases of top artificial intelligence (AI) stocks during the first quarter . If a fund has over $100 million in assets, it is required to divulge its end-of-quarter holdings to the SEC .  During the first quarter, Tiger Global Management purchased a few big-time AI stocks . These included Microsoft, Amazon, Nvidia, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing . All four of these stocks were already in the fund's portfolio prior to Q1 .  Taiwan Semiconductor stock can be purchased for under 21 times forward earnings . This is a lower-than-market multiple, yet Taiwan Semi is expected to deliver monster growth over the next five years . Management believes its AI-related revenue can increase at a 45% compound annual growth rate (CAGR)  Wall Street analysts expect 53% revenue growth in fiscal year 2026 (ending January 2026) and 24% next year . Amazon isn't a revenue growth story; it's a margin expansion story . Microsoft is expected to grow revenue at a 14% and 13% pace in 2025 and 2026 .  While Microsoft has proven to be a strong and resilient business over the past few years, I don't think I'd want to own the stock as much as the other three . It's just as expensive as Amazon and Nvidia, yet it doesn't have quite the growth upside to justify the cost . Microsoft isn't abadAI stock to own, but it's at the bottom of my list for the four AI stocks Tiger Global Management bought this quarter . The S&P 500 soared 6.2% this month through Thursday, putting it on track for the biggest May gain since 1990 . The blistering rally, propelled by a reprieve from President Donald Trump’s tariff offensive, has left the benchmark within 4% of its February record .  Pricey valuations, muted demand for hedges and stretched investor positioning have left stocks vulnerable to a pullback . The S&P 500 has risen just 0.2% on average in June over the past three decades . Fault lines are already forming after a Thursday rally mostly stalled out as solid results from Nvidia Corp. were overshadowed by uncertainties .  In post-US presidential election years over the past seven decades, the S&P 500 has typically struggled in early June . The adage “sell in May and go away” alludes to a six-month stretch ending in October that historically has been the worst time to own stocks .  Fund managers have reduced cash holdings and invested heavily in US stocks in recent weeks . That bullish tilt raises questions over who’s left to buy after fund managers piled into stocks at a furious pace in May . Tesla's electric vehicle sales are plummeting, and continued weakness could lead to massive losses for the stock . CEO Elon Musk believes self-driving cars and humanoid robots will eventually make Tesla the world's most valuable company one day . Today, those five companies areMicrosoft,Apple,Nvidia,Amazon, and Alphabet, and they have a combined market capitalization of $13.6 trillion .  Tesla is seeing plummeting demand for electric vehicles . Most of its revenue still comes from selling electric vehicles (EVs) Tesla can't grow production 50% per year if sales aren't keeping up . Deliveries plunged even further in the first quarter of 2025 .  Analyst estimates indicate Tesla might deliver as little as 350,000 cars during the second quarter, or a year-over-year drop of more than 20% . EV sales overall soared 28% across Europe in April . Chinese automakerBYDsaw 359% increase in sales across the region .  Last October, Tesla unveiled its long-awaited Cybercab robotaxi . It has no pedals or steering wheel because it's designed to run entirely on the company's Full Self-Driving (FSD) software . The unsupervised version of Tesla's FSD isn't approved for use on public roads yet .  Tesla CEO Musk says the company could generate $10 trillion in revenue over the long term . The company could be producing millions of robots annually by 2029 or 2030 . The Optimus robot could be used for dangerous jobs and repetitive tasks that humans don't want to do .  Tesla's stock is trading at an eyewatering price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 186.5 . Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon, Apple, and Alphabet trade at an average P/E ratio of just 32.2: Tesla's earnings per share (EPS)plunged 71% during the first quarter of 2025 .  Tesla is destined for a sharp decline instead, bringing its P/E ratio in line with those of its big-tech peers . As a result, there is little hope the company will grow to exceed the combined value of Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon, Apple and Alphabet anytime soon . Appaloosa's billionaire chief David Tepper completely exited or substantially reduced his fund's stakes in five brand-name artificial intelligence (AI) stocks in the March-ended quarter . The deadline for institutional investors overseeing at least $100 million to fileForm 13F with the Securities and Exchange Commission was May 15 .  David Tepper of Appaloosa Management traded 130,000 shares in AI-networking specialistBroadcom . Tepper's net-selling of artificial intelligence stocks was his first-quarter trading activity . As of the end of March, Tepper oversaw close to $8.4 billion in assets under management .  Based on Appaloosa's 13F, Tepper sold shares of five prominent artificial intelligence stocks in the March-ended quarter . It's quite possible this selling activity represents nothing more than simple profit-taking . Shares of Nvidia, Microsoft, AMD, Lam Research have all rocketed higher as the AI revolution has taken shape .  The worry is that there may be more than just benign profit-taking and/or stop losses (in Intel's case) behind Tepper's aggressive net selling of AI stocks . On one hand, demand for AI-graphics processing units (GPUs) and AI solutions has been exceptionally strong . Nvidia's Hopper (H100) and Blackwell GPUs hold a seemingly insurmountable market share lead in AI-accelerated data centers . Intel's central processing units are also playing a role in the expansion of AI-data center infrastructure .  Many of Nvidia's largest customers are internally developing AI chips to use in their data centers . This is expected to weigh on Nvidia's pricing power, as well as AMD and possibly even Intel . It also has the potential to adversely impact the pricing power for semiconductor equipment companies like Lam Research .  If the AI bubble were to burst, we'd see widespread weakness among the five prominent AI stocks Tepper completely exited or reduced in the March-ended quarter . Every game-changing technology needs time to mature, and AI isn't anywhere close to having reached the point of maturity .  David Tepper may be allowing these odds to partially guide his investment strategy . Taiwan is continuing efforts to secure a trade deal with the US, a top official in Taipei said . A court blocked many of the tariffs that President Donald Trump has threatened to impose on other countries . Taiwan remains committed to negotiations, Deputy Foreign Minister Chen Ming-chi said in an interview .  Trump's use of tariff threats to pressure other countries into cutting new trade deals was thrown into turmoil after a court said the US president exceeded his authority . An appeals court offered Trump a temporary reprieve from the ruling but the saga could delay negotiations with other trading partners . Taiwan President Lai Ching-te has sought to downplay any tensions while highlighting the strength of relations with the US .  US pause is set to lift and will push for Washington to drop Taiwan’s tariffs “as low as possible” Chen indicated Taiwan had some room to lower tariffs on some US goods such as automobiles . Chen also said Taiwan would open its market to more US agricultural products .  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. said it would invest an additional $100 billion in the US . Chen said potential US tariffs on chip imports could complicate Taiwanese investments . Such levies would affect companies' cash flows, he said, hurting their ability to invest . US President Donald Trump declared a ‘total reset’ with China following a trade truce in Geneva . Trump’s administration on Wednesday announced it would start revoking Chinese student visas . It also introduced new restrictions on the sales of chip design software and reportedly some jet engine parts to China .  US and China negotiators brought down tariffs from eye-watering levels for 90-days . But they still need to hammer out a deal to rebalance trade — that took years in Trump's first term . Both sides are also in disagreement over Beijing’s role in the illegal fentanyl trade, rare earths and chip controls .  China’s Foreign Ministry called the visa policy “discriminatory” at a regular briefing in Beijing . The relatively restrained response suggests Beijing is trying to avoid sending ties into another tailspin . Republicans and Democrats alike now view China as a major threat to American security .  John Moolenaar, chairman of the House Select Committee on the Chinese Communist Party, denies the US actions were designed to target ordinary people in China . He represents US lawmakers who are skeptical of China’s influence in the US .  Expelling Chinese students from the US threatens to reignite a flashpoint in ties from Trump’s first term . The US revoked over 1,000 visas of Chinese pupils and scholars in 2011 . “This will only stoke misunderstanding, mistrust and even hatred between two societies,” said Wu Xinbo .  In China, the hardening US stance was met with disbelief and resentment on social media . Creating a hostile environment for overseas students could push talent back toward China . That aligns with Beijing’s ambition to bolster domestic innovation, as Xi turns high-tech manufacturing into a growth driver .  Mark Zuckerberg Loves MAGA now. Will MAGA Ever Love him back? For the second quarter, Nvidia expects Q2 sales to be $45 billion, plus or minus 2% . Investors digested a U.S. trade court ruling against most of President Donald Trump's tariffs . They initially cheered the news, but by the time an appeals court reinstated the duties just before the Wall Street close, that optimism had largely evaporated . In my column today I look at how structurally higher borrowing costs in the coming years mean the fiscal 'precipice' Washington faces may be nearer than it seems .  Nvidia shares hit a 4-month high following firm's results and outlook, up 3.2% on the day and 65% from April 7 low . Japan's benchmark Nikkei 225 index rises nearly2%, its best day in over a month, and Chinese tech stocks climb 2.5% . U.S. Treasury yields fall as much as 5 bps across the curve, with a 7-year note auction registering strong demand .  The latest twists come just as tariff revenues were beginning to pick up . The administration will likely find other legal avenues to implement its tariffs if need be . The net effect may ultimately be minimal, but it could affect Washington's negotiations with major trade partners .  The White House hosted a private meeting with the Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Thursday . The two discussed growth, employment, and inflation . Trump reiterated his view that the Fed is making a "mistake" by not cutting rates .  U.S. public finances are deteriorating, but debt Cassandras have been warning of a fiscal day of reckoning for 40 years . Congressional Budget Office's baseline forecast sees federal debt held by the public rising to 117% of GDP over the next decade from 98% last year .  We may not see a full-blown debt crisis, but there's a sense that "the fiscal" matters for markets more now than it has for decades . In times of extreme crisis, the Fed can always buy huge quantities of U.S. bonds to stabilize the market .  In the event of a downturn, U.S. public finances would suffer the double whammy of shrinking taxreceipts and a surge in benefit payments, pushing the country closer to a fiscal cliff . An economic downturn would probably also prompt the Fed to lower interest rates, which would likely cause bondyields to fall and offer some relief on debt-servicing costs .  CBO projections are based on the expectation that the yield curve will "normalize" in the coming year . But what if the yieldcurve stays near current levels over the next decade? Federal debt held by the public could rise to 125% of GDP by 2034 . Interest payments as a share of revenues are already about to exceed their late-1980s peak .  The Trump administration's current budget bill is expected to add nearly $4 trillion to the federal debt over the next decade . One consequence of higher-for-longer U.S. interest ratesthen could be a much-heavier debt burden . The risk of this is especially pertinent today .
